body:
Benjamin, seems like the wind is that we don't want to add another dependency for this. So please do make a PR with any improvements you've made to the code, and then feel free to keep a mirror of the functionality in an external gem. Similar to what we've done with cache_digests and others.

On Sep 10, 2013, at 2:53 PM, Benjamin Fleischer <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @dhh I don't really want to focus on the rot aspect. I found dead code, broken code, poorly-maintained code, and code with a poorly-defined interface and improved or removed it as appropriate. I think Rails would be better off without this as a concern for the core team.
> 
> Anyway, it would be great if this PR were merged, closed, or sent back for dev.
> 
> It's been around a while, and though I thought there was buy-in when I first proposed it, at this point I'd be happy with something more definitive.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
> 
>
